title: I reckon at least 40% of the games I lose are due to my internet...
body:
I'd love to know the real percentage because it's getting ridiculous.

inb4 *why play then*

Its so random though! For a week I'll get smooth 43 ping EVERY GAME, no dc's no nothing, and then the next day I'll dc twice, and then the game after that I'll have 300 ping, and then the next day I'll dc in loading screen in every game that day and then I get smooth games for the next 3 days and then bam. And sometimes I have 43 ping and 160 fps but I still lag.

But srs, too many gaems fml kms

replies.body:
>And sometimes I have 43 ping and 160 fps but I still lag.

Where is your modem compared to where you are?

As you may be experiencing packet loss.
Oh is that what it is? Coz my router and my room are in opposite ends of the house :/

> [{quoted}](name=Olee,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=Xuic7yhY,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2015-12-16T15:47:33.341+0000)
>
> Oh is that what it is? Coz my router is and my room are in opposite ends of the house :/

If your walls are concrete it can interrupt the signal between even 1 room, let alone the router being down the hallway between multiple walls and your computers modem.

I get solid ping with no interruptions on wireless net, so I don't think it's league related and it's most likely your net/where your router is.
They're not concrete but damn, I guess that's what it is, there isn't really a way around it either, it's the only router socket thingo
I don't download anything while I play League

And you are the only one in the house?

No family/housemates/freeloading neighbours using the bandwidth?
